Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Three Oil Lamps in Decorative Shapes
Description: Three oil lamps were manufactured in a beautifully artistic manner. The first lamp has two handles. It is decorated with a parrot standing on the branch of a tree. The design is within a four-lined circle. The second lamp has a larger reservoir to hold more oil; therefore, the lamp is also larger. It has more than one opening for wicks, in order to produce more light; the handle is broken. The third lamp is characterized by its beautiful shape, which is that of a shell. It has three wick openings, and one opening to fill it with oil. In addition to its beautiful shape it is harmoniously colored.
